buttons.name: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare (MoHFW)
buttons.primary_use: The main portal for all health-related policies, official announcements, press releases, major programmes (like Communicable and Non-Communicable Diseases control), and key documents (Acts, Rules, Standards).

buttons.name: National Health Mission (NHM)
buttons.primary_use: Focuses on programmes for maternal, newborn, child, and adolescent health (RMNCAH+N), urban and rural health missions, and public health infrastructure. Contains details on schemes like JSSK, RBSK, etc.

buttons.name: Ayushman Bharat - PM-JAY
buttons.primary_use: The official source for the world's largest government-funded health assurance scheme. Provides information on benefits (â‚¹5 Lakh cover per family/year), eligibility criteria, hospital empanelment, and scheme guidelines.

buttons.name: PM-JAY Beneficiary Portal
buttons.primary_use: Allows eligible citizens to check their status, create/download their Ayushman Card, link Aadhaar, add family members, and access self-service features for cashless hospitalization.

buttons.name: Ayushman Bharat Digital Mission (ABDM)
buttons.primary_use: The mission to create India's digital health ecosystem. The primary public-facing component is the creation of the Ayushman Bharat Health Account (ABHA) number (your unique health ID) for seamless digital sharing of health records.

buttons.name: ABHA Portal
buttons.primary_use: Specifically for citizens to create their ABHA ID (14-digit unique health identifier) and manage the consent for linking and sharing their digital health records (prescriptions, lab reports).

buttons.name: Central Government Health Scheme (CGHS)
buttons.primary_use: Provides comprehensive healthcare facilities to Central Government employees, pensioners, and their dependents. Includes details on medical benefits, wellness centres, and empanelled hospitals.

buttons.name: National Health Portal (NHP)
buttons.primary_use: A one-stop access point for authenticated health information and services for citizens, healthcare professionals, and researchers. It often hosts directories for hospitals, blood banks, disease information (Health A-Z), and lifestyle guides.

buttons.name: Co-WIN Portal
buttons.primary_use: Used for registration and scheduling of COVID-19 and other public health vaccinations, and for downloading vaccination certificates.

buttons.name: National TB Elimination Programme (NTEP) / TB Mukt Bharat Abhiyan
buttons.primary_use: Provides information on Tuberculosis (TB) symptoms, free diagnosis and treatment, and the process to adopt a TB patient under the Ni-Kshay Mitra initiative.

buttons.name: Reproductive and Child Health (RCH) Portal
buttons.primary_use: Used for monitoring and implementation of various maternal and child health interventions under the NHM, including services like antenatal care, safe delivery, and immunization.

buttons.name: e-Sanjeevani (Telemedicine)
buttons.primary_use: A National Telemedicine Service that provides doctor-to-patient (OPD) and doctor-to-doctor consultations from the comfort of home, especially beneficial for rural areas.

buttons.name: e-DantSeva (National Oral Health Programme)
buttons.primary_use: Provides comprehensive information on oral health, dental diseases, preventive measures, and a directory of dental facilities and professionals across India.

buttons.name: Health Management Information System (HMIS)
buttons.primary_use: Primarily for government use (data collection, monitoring, and evaluation of health programmes), but provides public access to data, reports, and dashboards on healthcare performance.

buttons.name: Mera Aspataal (My Hospital) Initiative
buttons.primary_use: A platform for collecting patient feedback on the quality of services received at public healthcare facilities. Citizens can provide feedback via SMS, web, or mobile app.
